name: electricity production, high voltage, for Swiss Federal Railways | electricity, high voltage, for Swiss Federal Railways | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5251/documentation

This dataset represents the production of electricity at high voltage for the Swiss Federal Railways (SBB/CFF/FFS). The electricity mix used by the Swiss Railways for the year 2017 consists of 87.94 % hydropower, 10.76% nuclear power and 1.3 % new renewables.

This activity starts from the different electricity producing technologies producing electricity at high voltage for the Swiss Federal Railways.

This dataset includes shares of company owned production and purchased electricity from Swiss and French power plants and from the spot market.
This dataset doesn't include the share of 0.1% of electricity from photovoltaics.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for the year 2017 (latest consistent statistics available at the time of dataset creation).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data apply to self-owned power plants and electricity purchased by the Swiss Federal Railways.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: No technology description is provided because the dataset just describes the power plant portfolio of SBB using current average technology per energy carrier.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage, for Swiss Federal Railways
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Personal communication with SBB (2019, 2011). Data representing the electricity mix of the Swiss Federal Railways in 2017. The split of nuclear power technolgies was not available for the 2019 SBB electricity mix. Therefore, the nuclear technology split was applied as of 2011 information from SBB (personal communcation with SBB).  There is also a low share of electricity from photovoltaics in the SBB mix, which is neglected in this dataset.
